sentences.text: On 8 January 2025, an attack was carried out against the presidential palace, known as the {{Ill|Palais Rose (Tchad)|lt=Pink Palace|fr}}, in the Chadian capital N'Djamena by unknown attackers. The 24 attackers attempted to gain entry through a security gate of the presidential palace before being confronted by security forces. Chadian President Mahamat Déby was inside the presidential palace at the time, and he later released a thanking guards for thwarting the attack.<ref name=":9" />

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=8 January 2025 |title=Gunshots heard near presidency in Chad capital N'Djamena, residents and AFP say |url=https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-836715 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250109002131/https://www.jpost.com/breaking-news/article-836715 |archive-date=9 January 2025 |access-date=8 January 2025 |website=The Jerusalem Post |language=en |agency=Reuters}}</ref>

<ref name="lefigaro">{{Cite web |date=8 January 2025 |title=Tchad: tirs nourris dans le centre de N'Djamena, près de la présidence |trans-title=Chad: Heavy gunfire in the centre of N'Djamena, near the presidency |url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-actu/tchad-tirs-nourris-dans-le-centre-de-n-djamena-pres-de-la-presidence-20250108 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250109002316/https://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-actu/tchad-tirs-nourris-dans-le-centre-de-n-djamena-pres-de-la-presidence-20250108 |archive-date=9 January 2025 |access-date=8 January 2025 |website=Le Figaro |language=fr |agency=Agence France-Presse}}</ref>

<ref name="dw.co">{{Cite web |date=9 January 2025 |title=Chad: Gunfire heard near presidency in N'Djamena |url=https://www.dw.com/en/chad-gunfire-heard-near-presidency-in-ndjamena/a-71251244 |access-date=8 January 2025 |website=Deutsche Welle}}</ref>

<ref name=":12" /> A total of 20 people were killed in the attack, of which 18 were attackers and two were presidential guards.<ref name=":11">{{Cite web |last=Fischer |first=Nikolas |date=January 16, 2025 |title=With French troops leaving, what does Chad's future hold? |url=https://www.dw.com/en/what-does-chads-break-with-france-mean-for-the-countrys-stability/a-71295982 |access-date=2025-01-18 |website=DW |language=en |archive-date=18 January 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250118041104/https://www.dw.com/en/what-does-chads-break-with-france-mean-for-the-countrys-stability/a-71295982 |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: The attack was described by the Minister of Foreign Affairs (Chad)|Minister of Foreign Affairs as an "attempt at destabilization". However, he denied it was a terrorist attack, and described the attackers as disorganized bandits. An investigation by the government has been launched into the motivations of the attackers and their affiliations; however, sources report that it was carried out by Jihadist group Boko Haram.<ref name=":6" /> The country has faced an insurgency by Boko Haram since 2014. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack.<ref name=":10" /> Other analysts however, disagreed with this.<ref name=":11" />

references.text: <ref>{{Cite news |last=Hoije |first=Katarina |date=8 January 2025 |title=Chad Army Foils Attack as Gunfire Erupts Near Presidency |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-01-08/chad-army-foils-attack-as-gunfire-erupts-near-presidency |access-date=12 January 2025 |work=Bloomberg News |publisher= |language=en}}</ref>

<ref name=":4">{{Cite web |last=Boudombo |first=Armand Mouko |date=8 January 2025 |title=Coups de feu à la présidence du Tchad : qui voulait 'vitrifier' Mahamat Idriss Deby? |trans-title=Gunshots at the Chadian presidency: who wanted to 'vitrify' Mahamat Idriss Deby? |url=https://www.bbc.com/afrique/articles/c5ydyklkeyzo |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250112164534/https://www.bbc.com/afrique/articles/c5ydyklkeyzo |archive-date=12 January 2025 |access-date=13 January 2025 |website=BBC News|BBC News Afrique |publisher= |place=Dakar |language=fr}}</ref>

sentences.text:
{{Main|Boko Haram insurgency}}
Since 2014, Boko Haram has been active in western Chad, launching cross-border attacks from the Nigerian border against civilian and military targets in western Chad. In 2024, attacks by the militant group in Chad intensified, culminating in a raid on a Chadian military base near the village of Ngouboua, which left 40 Chadian soldiers dead. Additionally, Chad has faced groups linked to Islamic State and Al-Qaeda|Al Qaeda.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |title=A Decade After Chibok: Assessing Nigeria's Regional Response to Boko Haram |url=https://acleddata.com/2024/04/16/a-decade-after-chibok-assessing-nigerias-regional-response-to-boko-haram/ |date=16 April 2024 |access-date=9 January 2025 |website=Armed Conflict Location and Event Data |language=en |archive-date=7 October 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241007014159/https://acleddata.com/2024/04/16/a-decade-after-chibok-assessing-nigerias-regional-response-to-boko-haram/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |date=28 October 2024 |title=Jihadist attack near Lake Chad leaves 40 dead, president orders retaliation |url=https://www.rfi.fr/en/africa/20241028-jihadist-attack-near-lake-chad-leaves-40-dead-president-orders-retaliation |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250103105833/https://www.rfi.fr/en/africa/20241028-jihadist-attack-near-lake-chad-leaves-40-dead-president-orders-retaliation |archive-date=3 January 2025 |access-date=9 January 2025 |website=Radio France Internationale }}</ref>

<ref name=":8">{{Cite news |last=Ramadane |first=Mahamat |date=9 January 2025 |title=Chad investigates foiled attempt to storm presidential compound |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/chad-says-foiled-attack-presidency-was-work-disorganised-intoxicated-group-2025-01-09/ |access-date=12 January 2025 |work=Reuters }}</ref>

sentences.text: The increased violence by Boko Haram comes amid French military withdrawal from West Africa (2022–present)|a withdrawal of French forces from the region. France, traditionally a strong ally of the Chadian government, had provided military aid to Chad for decades, offering training for the Chadian military and intervening with airstrikes against insurgents. On 29 November 2024, during a visit by French Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot to N'Djamena, the Chadian government announced an end to Chad's defense agreement with France, and requested French military personnel to leave the country. By December, most French troops had left Chad, with the remaining troops due to leave by the end of January. President Déby has pushed to have closer ties to Hungary, China, Russia, and the United Arab Emirates.

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |last=Lawal |first=Shola |date=3 January 2025 |title=Frexit: Why Ivory Coast is joining African campaign to expel French troops |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/3/frexit-why-ivory-coast-is-joining-african-campaign-to-expel-french-troops |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250105053617/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/3/frexit-why-ivory-coast-is-joining-african-campaign-to-expel-french-troops |archive-date=5 January 2025 |access-date=9 January 2025 |website=Al Jazeera |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text:
|left]]
The attack began at around 8:45 pm. At least 24 armed men attacked the presidential palace in the Chadian capital city N'Djamena. The attack happened hours after Central Foreign Affairs Commission|CCP foreign chief Wang Yi visited the capital. Civilians fled the area in cars and on motorcycles to escape the violence.<ref name=":3" /> In the confusion, some civilians reportedly believed a coup d'état was taking place.<ref name=":4" />

references.text: <ref name="lefigaro" /><ref name=":3">{{Cite web |date=January 8, 2025 |title=Tchad: tirs nourris dans le centre de N'Djamena, près de la présidence |trans-title=Chad: Heavy gunfire in the centre of N'Djamena, near the presidency |url=https://www.dakaractu.com/Tchad-tirs-nourris-dans-le-centre-de-N-Djamena-pres-de-la-presidence_a257449.html |access-date=8 January 2025 |website=Dakaractu |language=fr}}</ref>

<ref name="lefigaro" /><ref>{{Cite web |last=Ramadane |first=Mahamat |date=8 January 2025 |title=Gunfire heard near the presidency of Chad's capital, military vehicles seen |url=https://www.reuters.com/world/africa/gunshots-heard-near-presidency-chad-capital-ndjamena-residents-afp-say-2025-01-08/ |access-date=8 January 2025 |website=Reuters}}</ref>

<ref name="lefigaro" /> The attackers drove up to the security gate and pretended that their vehicle had a Breakdown (vehicle)|mechanical failure before starting the attack.<ref name=":8" /> Reports of gunfire continued until 9:30 pm.<ref name=":4" /> Chadian President Mahamat Déby was inside the palace at the time of the attack and the attackers were attempting to storm the palace.<ref name=":2">{{Cite news |last=Mureithi |first=Carlos |date=9 January 2025 |title=Chad's government says 19 killed during foiled attack on presidential complex |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/jan/09/chads-government-says-18-killed-during-foiled-attack-on-presidential-complex |access-date=12 January 2025 |work=The Guardian |language=en-GB |issn=0261-3077 }}</ref>

<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |date=8 January 2025 |title=Gunfire Heard Near Presidency In Chad Capital: AFP |url=https://www.barrons.com/news/gunfire-heard-near-presidency-in-chad-capital-afp-ee122459 |access-date=8 January 2025 |website=Barron's |agency=Agence France-Presse}}</ref>

sentences.text: According to Chadian Foreign Minister Abderaman Koulamallah they were armed with knives and Machete|machetes. Afterwards they attempted to gain entry into the presidential palace, where they engaged in combat with security forces. and that they were killed after penetrating the camp surrounding the presidency. Videos of the bodies of dead attackers as well as men captured during the attack were circulating on social media.

references.text: <ref name=":8" /> He said "They stabbed four guards, killing one and seriously injuring two others. A fourth guard was also injured, but his life is not in danger."<ref name=":7">{{Cite web |last1=Ewokor |first1=Chris |last2=Cooney |first2=Christy |date=9 January 2025 |title=Chad foils attempt to destabilise country – minister |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/clyky6l7pj5o |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250109005207/https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/clyky6l7pj5o |archive-date=9 January 2025 |access-date=11 January 2025 |website=BBC News }}</ref>

<ref name=":2" /> According to Koulamallah, 18 attackers were killed and six were injured, while one member of the security forces was killed and five were critically injured.<ref name=":5" /> He further stated that the attackers were dressed in civilian clothing during the attack<ref>{{Cite web |date=2025-01-09 |title=Chad capital calm after quashed armed assault on presidential palace |url=https://www.france24.com/en/africa/20250109-chad-capital-calm-after-quashed-armed-assault-on-presidential-palace |access-date=2025-01-18 |website=France 24 |language=en |archive-date=19 January 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250119185544/https://www.france24.com/en/africa/20250109-chad-capital-calm-after-quashed-armed-assault-on-presidential-palace |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite web |last1=Lawal |first1=Shola |last2=Noubarassem |first2=Blaise |date=9 January 2025 |title=Chad's presidency attacked: Coup attempt, Boko Haram or 'drunk' fighters? |url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/chads-presidency-attacked-coup-attempt-boko-haram-or-drunk-fighters |access-date=2025-01-18 |website=Al Jazeera |language=en |archive-date=18 January 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250118220119/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2025/1/9/chads-presidency-attacked-coup-attempt-boko-haram-or-drunk-fighters |url-status=live }}</ref>

<ref name=":12">{{Cite web |last=Pondy Nyaga |first=Harmony |date=2025-01-09 |title=Chad says 20 killed in bid to storm presidential palace |url=https://www.wfmz.com/partners/afp/chad-says-20-killed-in-bid-to-storm-presidential-palace/article_daa4de5b-c8b4-53e2-840d-65f6f1daaf39.html |access-date=2025-01-20 |website=WFMZ-TV |language=en |agency=Agence France-Presse}}</ref>

sentences.text: Koulamallah added that the attackers were local youth from N'Djamena and were disorganized and intoxicated by alcohol and drugs. He referred to them as "Les Pieds Nickelés|''Pieds Nickelés''", in reference to a French comics|French comic series about criminals. He said that "We found that they had a lot of alcohol, small bottles of water filled with alcohol. It looks like whiskey or something like that. Also some drugs, they were completely drugged, at least the survivors."<ref name=":7" /> He ruled out that it was a terrorist attack.<ref name=":4" />

references.text: <ref name=":9">{{Cite web |date=January 9, 2025 |title=Attack on Chad's presidential palace leaves 19 dead |url=https://apnews.com/article/chad-presidential-palace-deadly-97638ecd7ad4e55a27955ad705f31bdb |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250110200514/https://apnews.com/article/chad-presidential-palace-deadly-97638ecd7ad4e55a27955ad705f31bdb |archive-date=10 January 2025 |access-date=9 January 2025 |website=AP News |language=en}}</ref>

<ref>{{Cite news |date=9 January 2025 |title=Gunfire inside Chad's presidential palace kills 19, several injured |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/en/international/article/2025/01/09/gunfire-inside-chad-s-presidential-palace-leaves-19-dead-several-injured_6736847_4.html |access-date=12 January 2025 |work=Le Monde |language=en |agency=Agence France-Presse}}</ref>

sentences.text: In contrast, an anonymous source connected to the Chadian security services told the media that the attackers belonged to the Jihadist group Boko Haram. The sources say that the men were instead armed with firearms when they attacked the Presidential Palace.<ref name=":6" />

references.text: <ref name=":6">{{Cite web |date=8 January 2025 |title=Attack on Chad's presidential complex in N'Djamena leaves 19 dead |url=https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20250108-%F0%9F%94%B4-gunfire-heard-near-presidency-in-chad-s-capital-n-djamena-afp |access-date=11 January 2025 |website=France 24 |language=en }}</ref>

<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |date=8 January 2025 |title=Tchad : situation sous contrôle après des tirs nourris d'armes à N'Djamena |trans-title=Chad: Situation under control after heavy gunfire in N'Djamena |url=https://www.alwihdainfo.com/Tchad-situation-sous-controle-apres-des-tirs-nourris-d-armes-a-N-Djamena_a137815.html |access-date=8 January 2025 |website=Alwihda Info |language=fr }}</ref>

sentences.text: In response to the attack, the Chad National Army blocked all roads leading to the presidential palace, and armed personnel were deployed on the streets. No group has claimed responsibility for the attack as of 9{{Nbsp}}January.<ref name=":10" />

references.text: <ref>{{Cite web |date=8 January 2025 |title=Gunfire heard near presidency in Chad's capital N'Djamena |url=https://www.france24.com/en/live-news/20250108-%F0%9F%94%B4-gunfire-heard-near-presidency-in-chad-s-capital-n-djamena-afp |access-date=8 January 2025 |website=France 24 |language=en }}</ref>

<ref name=":0" /> Armored vehicles could be seen in the capital<ref name=":1" /> driving towards the palace.<ref name="dw.co" /><ref name=":6" /> As of 9{{Nbsp}}January, six people have been arrested in connection with the attack, though no specific information was further released.<ref>{{Cite web |last1=Ewokor |first1=Chris |last2=Cooney |first2=Christy |date=January 9, 2025 |title=Chad foils attempt to destabilise country - minister |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/clyky6l7pj5o |access-date=2025-01-18 |website=BBC |language=en-GB |archive-date=9 January 2025 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250109005207/https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/clyky6l7pj5o |url-status=live }}</ref>

sentences.text: The Chinese foreign ministry said it firmly supports Chad's efforts to ensure its safety and stability.
